metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18248 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The add_job function in scheduler/ipp.c in CUPS before 2.2.6, when D-Bus support is enabled, can be crashed by remote attackers by sending print jobs with an invalid username, related to a D-Bus notification.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.6-5
cups-bsd - 2.2.6-5
cups-client - 2.2.6-5
cups-common - 2.2.6-5
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.6-5
cups-daemon - 2.2.6-5
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.6-5
cups-ppdc - 2.2.6-5
cups-server-common - 2.2.6-5
libcups2 - 2.2.6-5
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.6-5
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.6-5
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.6-5
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.6-5').
